org.ambraproject.wombat.controller

Class WombatController

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.ambraproject.wombat.controller.WombatController
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    ArticleController, BrowseController, FigureImageController, FigurePageController, HomeController, IndirectFileController, NotFoundController, RootController, SearchController, StaticResourceController, TemplatePageController, UserController

    public abstract class WombatController
extends Object
    Base class with common functionality for all controllers in the application.

      • validateArticleVisibility

        protected void validateArticleVisibility(Site site,
                             Map<?,?> articleMetadata)
        Validate that an article ought to be visible to the user. If not, throw an exception indicating that the user should see a 404.

        An article may be invisible if it is not in a published state, or if it has not been published in a journal corresponding to the site.

        Parameters:
        site - the site on which the article was queried
        articleMetadata - the article metadata, or a subset containing the state and journals fields
        Throws:
        NotVisibleException - if the article is not visible on the site

      • requireNonemptyParameter

        protected static void requireNonemptyParameter(String parameter)
        Check that a request parameter is not empty.

        This is useful for validating that the user didn't supply an empty string as a URL parameter, such as by typing ".../article?doi" into the browser bar when ".../article?id=10.0/foo" is expected. The required argument on RequestParam merely guarantees the parameter to be non-null, not non-empty.

        Parameters:
        parameter - a non-null value supplied as a RequestParam
        Throws:
        NotFoundException - if the parameter is empty
        NullPointerException - if the parameter is null

      • booleanParameter

        protected static boolean booleanParameter(String parameterValue)
        Interpret a URL parameter as a boolean. In general, interpret null as false and all non-null strings, including the empty string, as true. But the string "false" is (case-insensitively) false.

        The empty string is true because it represents a URL parameter as being present but with no value, e.g. http://example.com/page?foo. Contrast Boolean.valueOf(String), which returns false for the empty string.

        Parameters:
        parameterValue - a URL parameter value
        Returns:
        the boolean value

      • copyAssetRequestHeaders

        protected static org.apache.http.Header[] copyAssetRequestHeaders(javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest request)
        Copy headers from an asset request if they are whitelisted. This effectively translates from the javax.servlet model (used by Spring model) into the Apache model.
        Parameters:
        request - a request
        Returns:
        its headers
